title: OSDM Online Schemas for schema validation
description: OSDM Online Schemas for schema validation

FulfillmentRequestAcceptedResponse.description: Fulfillment successfully initiated, retrieve booking to retrieve the fulfillment documents

Warning.description:
This element can be used to pass non-blocking information or events,
such as a price difference with the initially offered price at booking time.
It is inspired on the JSon problem structure.

type.description:
An absolute URI that identifies the warning type. When dereferenced,
it SHOULD provide human-readable documentation for the problem type
(e.g., using HTML).

detail.description:
A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the
warning.
detail.example: The price of the given offer part has been updated during the booking operation

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the warning.

PlaceRequest.description:
Initial input for the place information request. This input defines what is originally looked for.
Provided by OJP.

PlaceParam.description: More parameters for restricting the request. Provided by OJP.

numberOfResults.description:
Maximum number of results to be returned. The service is allowed to return fewer objects if reasonable
or otherwise appropriate.

InitialPlaceInput.description:
Initial input for the place information request. This input defines what is originally looked for.
Provided by OJP.

name.description:
Name of the place object which is looked after. This is usually the user's input. If not given,
the name of the resulting place objects is not relevant.

TripSearchCriteria.description: Trip request structure. Provided by OJP.

arrivalTime.description: requested arrival time. If arrival time is provided the departure time must be omitted.

vias.description:
Ordered series of points where the journey must pass through. If more
than one via point is given all of them must be obeyed - in the correct
order. The server is allowed to replace a via stop by equivalent stops.

embed.description: Influences whether referenced resources are returned in full or as references only. Proposed default ALL

TripVia.description: Via restrictions for a trip. Provided by OJP.

dwellTime.description: desired dwell time at the via place

BaseTripPolicyFilter.description:
Policies that control the trip search behavior for both public and individual transport.
Provided by OJP.

noSingleStep.description: The user is not able to climb one step, i.e. wheel chair.

noSight.description: The user is not able to see.

TripMobilityFilter.description:
Base mobility options to be applied for both public and individual transport.
Provided by OJP.

bikeTransport.description: The user wants to carry a bike on public transport.

walkSpeed.description: Deviation from average walk speed in percent. 100% percent is average speed.

additionalTransferTime.description:
Additional time added to all transfers (also to transfers between individual to
public transport).

ModeFilter.description: List of public transport modes to include or exclude. Provided by OJP.

exclude.description: Whether modes in list are to include or exclude from search.

transportModes.description: List of Transport modes to include/exclude.

CarrierFilter.description: Filter for in/exclusion of carriers. Provided by OJP.

exclude.description: Whether carrier in list are to include or exclude from search.

ServiceBrandFilter.description: Filter for in/exclusion of service brands. Provided by OJP.

exclude.description: Whether service brand in list are to include or exclude from search.

VehicleFilter.description: Filter for in/exclusion of vehicle based on vehicle number or line number.

exclude.description: Whether vehicle in list is to include or exclude from search.

PointOfInterestFilter.description: Filter POIs by category. Provided by OJP.

exclude.description: Whether carriers are to be included or excluded from the filtering.

pointOfInterestCategory.description:
These POI categories can be used to filter POIs. If more than one is given the filtering
is by logical 'OR' (when Exclude=FALSE) and logical 'AND' (when Exclude=TRUE).

TripDataFilter.description: Data to be included/excluded from search, f.e. modes, carriers. Provided by OJP.

TripParameters.description:
Options to control the search behavior and response contents.
number of results > either number of results or number of results before and after are used.
Provided by OJP.

transferLimit.description: The maximum number of interchanges the user will accept per trip.

TripCollectionResponse.description: Trip response structure. Provided by OJP.

Trip.description: A complete trip from origin to destination. Provided by OJP.

id.description: Id of this trip for referencing purposes. Unique within a trip.

externalRef.description: External reference of this trip for referencing purposes.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the trip.

distance.description: Distance in meters over the the complete trip, i.e., including transfer legs.

operatingDaysDescription.description: Textual description of the operation days, e.g. 'Monday to Friday' or 'Not on holidays'.

id.description: Id of this trip for referencing purposes. Unique within trip response.

unplanned.description: Whether this trip is an additional one that has not been planned.

cancelled.description: Whether this trip is cancelled and will not be run.

deviation.description: Whether this trip deviates from the planned service pattern.

infeasible.description: Whether this trip cannot be used, due to operational delays and impossible transfers.

TripSpecification.description: A minimal trip specification from origin to destination.

externalRef.description: External reference of this trip for referencing purposes. Unique within a trip specification.

OperatingDays.description:
Day of public transport operation of which the characteristics are defined in a specific
service calendar and which may last more than 24 hours. Provided by OJP.

pattern.description:
Bit pattern for operating days between start date and end date.
The length of the pattern is equal to the number of days from
start date to end date. A bit value of '1' indicates that an event
actually happens on the day that is represented by the bit position.

TripLeg.description:
A single stage of a trip that is made without change of MODE or service (ie:
between each interchange). Provided by OJP.

id.description: Id of this trip leg. Unique within trip result. A seqId is a leg id.

externalRef.description: External reference of this tripLeg for referencing purposes.
External reference of this trip leg. Unique within trip result.

TimedLeg.description: A leg which is bound to a timetabled schedule. Corresponds to a ride. Provided by OJP.

operatingDaysDescription.description: Textual description of the operation days, e.g. 'Monday to Friday' or 'not on holidays'.

TransferLeg.description:
A leg which links other legs of a trip where a transfer between different places is required.
Provided by OJP.

ContinuousLeg.description: A leg of a journey that is not bound to a timetable. Provided by OJP.

duration.description: Duration of this leg according to user preferences like walk speed.

ContinuousService.description:
A vehicle movement on a continuous, non-timetabled service.
Service of this leg. May be 'walk' in most cases, but also cycling or taxi etc.
Provided by OJP.

ContinuousMode.description: Types of modes that run at any time without a timetable. Provided by OJP.

IndividualMode.description: Modes which an individual powers themselves (such as walk, cycle). Provided by OJP.

TransferMode.description: Modes dedicated to perform transfers. Provided by OJP.

StopCallStatus.description: Status properties for the vehicle call at this stop. Provided by OJP.

order.description: Sequence number of this stop in the service pattern of the journey.

requestStop.description: The vehicle journey calls at this stop only on demand.

unplannedStop.description: This stop has not been planned by the planning department.

notServicedStop.description: The vehicle will not call at this stop despite earlier planning.

noBoardingAtStop.description: Boarding will not be allowed at this stop of this journey.

noAlightingAtStop.description: Alighting will not be allowed at this stop of this journey.

Board.description:
Describes the the situation at a stop or station at which the passenger boards a Leg
of a trip including time-related information. Provided by OJP.

plannedStopPointName.description:
Name of the bay/quay/terminal where to board/alight from the vehicle. According to
planned timetable.

estimatedStopPointName.description: Name of the bay/quay/terminal where to board the vehicle. As to the latest realtime status.

Intermediate.description:
Describes the situation at a stop or station that lies between the Board and
Alight stop or station including time-related information. Provided by OJP.

plannedStopPointName.description:
Name of the bay/quay/terminal where to board/alight from the vehicle. According to
planned timetable.

estimatedStopPointName.description: Name of the bay/quay/terminal where to board the vehicle. As to the latest realtime status.

Alight.description:
Describes the situation at a stop or station at which the passenger alights from a Leg
of a trip including time-related information. Provided by OJP.

plannedStopPointName.description:
Name of the bay/quay/terminal where to board/alight from the vehicle. According to
planned timetable.

estimatedStopPointName.description: Name of the bay/quay/terminal where to board the vehicle. As to the latest realtime status.

ServiceTime.description: Contains at least scheduled time, but can contain real time and estimated times. Provided by OJP.

DatedJourney.description: Vehicle journey that runs at a specific date. Provided by OJP.

publishedServiceName.description:
Line name or service description as known to the public, f.e. '512', 'S8'
or 'Circle Line' or 'ICE 488'.

Mode.description: A method of transportation such as bus, rail, etc. Provided by OJP.

shortName.description: Short name or acronym of the mode

description.description: Additional text that further describes the mode

PTMode.description: TAP-TSI/UIC contains a sensible subset of SIRI Transport Modes.

ProductCategory.description:
Product category based on NeTEx/SIRI. A product category is a classification for vehicle journeys
to express some common properties of journeys for marketing and fare products. Provided by OJP.

name.description:
Full name of this product category, e.g. 'TGV Lyria' in Switzerland and France.
UIC: Long name of Service Brand

shortName.description:
Short name or acronym of the product category, likely to be published, e.g. 'TGV'
UIC: Abbreviation of Service Brand

ServiceStatus.description:
Parameters which describe the current status of a dated vehicle journey.
Provided by OJP.

unplanned.description: Whether this trip is an additional one that has not been planned.

cancelled.description: Whether this trip is cancelled and will not be run.

deviation.description: Whether this trip deviates from the planned service pattern.

occupancy.description:
Passenger load status on vehicle. If omitted, not known.
Equivalent to siri:OccupancyEnumeration which describes three values:
'full', 'seatingAvailable' and 'standingAvailable'.

Place.description: A geographic place of any type which may be specified as the origin or destination of a trip. Provided by OJP.

objectType.description: Attribute is used as discriminator for inheritance between data types.

id.description: id  defining the place. The code is provided as URN, relative URNs are allowed with base path urn:uic:stn '0850000'

alternativeIds.description:
For a place with ids in different reference systems, the alternative ids can be returned. 
The reference system is encoded in the string. E.g.: "urn:uic:std:80000", "x_swe:stn:10000", "ch:1:sloid:343434"

Address.description:
A descriptive data associated with a place that can be used to describe the unique geographical context of a
place for the purposes of identifying it. may be refined as either a road address, a postal address or both.
Provided by OJP.

name.description: Name or description of address for use in passenger information.

topographicPlaceName.description: TopographicPlace name of the address. If set it should at least contain the city name.

houseNumber.description: House number of the address. If none is given, either a crossing street can be given, or the whole street is meant.

CountryCode.description: ISO country code (2 alpha), relative URNs with base urn:iso:std:iso:3166 are recommended

PointOfInterest.description:
A type of place to or through which passengers may wish to navigate as part of
their journey and which is modelled in detail by journey planners. Provided by OJP.

name.description: Name or description of point of interest for use in passenger information.

code.description: id of the Point of Interest.

PointOfInterestCategory.description: A categorization of points of interest in respect of the activities undertaken at them (defined by key-value-pairs). Provided by OJP.

pointOfInterestClassifications.description:
Classification of the POI (when it is not from OSM). The codification of the
classification Id may include de codification source (for example
'IGN:[classificationCode]')

OsmTag.description: Structure of an Open Street Map tag. Provided by OJP.

tag.description: Name of Open Street Map tag (amenity, leisure, tourism, bike, ...)

value.description: Value for Open Street Map tag (charging_station, hostel, yes, ...)

StopPlace.description:
A place extended by accessibility limitation properties and some attributes of the associated equipment,
comprising one or more places where vehicles may stop and where passengers may board or leave vehicles
or prepare their trip, and which will usually have one or more wellknown names. Provided by OJP.

name.description: Name of this stop place for use in passenger information.

objectType.description: Attribute is used as discriminator for inheritance between data types.

StopPlaceRef.description:
Reference to a Stop Place using URNs to define code.
For UIC see UIC MERITS/TAP-TSI station codes. Provided by OJP.

PointOfInterestRef.description: Reference to a Point of Interest. Provided by OJP.

FareConnectionPointRef.description: Reference to a Fare Connection Point.

GeoPositionRef.description: Reference to a GeoPosition consisting of latitude and longitude.

ProductCategoryRef.description:
Reference to a product category. Product categories should be defined once and used
uniformly in all channels (e.g. NeTEx, SIRI, OJP). Provided by OJP.

OperationDayRef.description: Reference to an operating day. Provided by OJP.

JourneyRef.description: Reference to a journey. Provided by OJP.

SituationFullRef.description:
Reference to situation message. Message details might be found in response
context or through other communication channels. Provided by OJP.

VehicleNumber.description:
The vehicle number(s) of the vehicle that runs this timed leg. On some legs a vehicle can
have multiple vehicle numbers, e.g. if it is split into two trains at a intermediate stop.
E.g. the vehicle numbers of 'TGV 9218', 'TH 9340' or 'ICE 15'.
For backwards compatibility with Hermes/Hosa the length of the string must be restricted
to 5 characters. If's longer, it is not possible to use the H2O converter.

LineNumber.description:
Especially on regional traffic, a vehicle is defined by a line number.
E.g. the line numbers of 'S 52' or 'B 19'.

flexibilities.description:
Defines the flexibility levels desired of the fares returned.
This refers to the after sales flexibility levels as defined in IRS-90918-10

travelClasses.description: The classes returned might be different from the requested classes.

serviceClassTypes.description: The classes returned might be different from the requested classes.

OfferPartType.description:
Allows to request offerparts of a certain type.
To support H/H use ['RESERVATION', 'ANCILLARY'].
Default is to get search for offers of all types.

OfferCollectionRequest.description:
Defines the parameters needed to request an offer. Either a tripSearchCriteria, a list of trip specifications, or a list of tripIds can be passed in to request offers.

If you are searching for fares you pass in the complete trip and the use the requestedSections attribute to define which part(s) you need fares (including virtual border points).

embed.description: Influences whether referenced resources are returned in full or as references only. Proposed default ALL

ReturnSearchParameters.description:
This property can be used in case a return trip is being requested.
This will allow to benefit from return-specific fares or product

inwardReturnDate.description:
Needs to be provided when creating the collection of outward travels so that the
provider knows when a return travel can be expected and propose appropriate
product and fares.

outwardOfferIds.description:
Needs to be provided when creating the collection of inward travels so that the provider
can relate the inward travels to the outward travels context.

outwardOfferTag.description:
Needs to be provided when creating the collection of inward travels so that the provider
knows what the outward offer is and and propose compatible offers only if desired or mandatory.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the offer.

preBookableUntil.description: time until the offer can be pre-booked, however its availability is not guaranteed

summary.description: A human-readable description of the offer.

preBookableUntil.description: time until the offer can be pre-booked, however its availability is not guaranteed

RequestedInformation.description:
Boolean-expression indicating the data that must be set in the data model in order to proceed to next step of the process. 

The syntax and semantics of the expression is described in detail in the OSDM documentation.

OfferSummary.description:
The offer summary indicates the most relevant service class, level, flexibility or accommodation
that describe this offer, but this does not imply that these values exactly apply to all parts of
the offer.
Let's consider, as a simplified example, a trip composed of two legs, one with both 1st and
2nd class, and one with only 2nd.
On this trip, the railway is expected to propose one offer with overallServiceClass FIRST composed
of one admission in 1st class on the first legs and one admission in 2nd class on the second one,
plus a second offer with overallServiceClass SECOND composed of two second class admissions.
Likewise for all 'overall' attributes. The purpose of these attributes is to convey to the client
system the service class, level, flexibility and accommodation that best represent this offer so to
facilitate presentation to the final user.

AbstractOfferPart.description: Generic offer object that contains all common information about an offer.

objectType.description: Attribute is used as discriminator for inheritance between data types.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the Offer.

validFrom.description: Time from which on the offer can be used, e.g. travel.

validUntil.description: Time until the offer can be used, e.g. travel.

priceGuaranteedUntil.description: Indicates until when the price for the given offer is guaranteed.

isReusable.description: Indicates whether the offerId can be used in more than one booking.

tripTags.description:
List of tags (and their type) that allow identifying sets of compatible offers when trying to combine multiple offers covering one single trip.
At least one (not all) tripTags must be in common to allow combination
If no tag is provided, there is no trip constraint on this specific offer.

returnTags.description:
List of tags (and their type) that allow identifying sets of compatible offers when booking a return trip
involving return-specific fares. All returnTags must be present in the counterpart offer to allow combination
If no tag is provided, there is no return constraint on this specific offer.

OfferTag.description:
The offerTag can/must (depending on the mandatory flag) be used in some cases to restrict the
set of offers returned in a subsequent and related offer search to only compatible ones.
Note the offerTag does not need to be unique.

BookedOffer.description: The attribute 'offerSummary' is meaningful at trip-offer-collection response time only.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the booked offer.

objectType.description: Attribute is used as discriminator for inheritance between data types.

products.description:
In offer mode, in almost all cases exactly one product is referenced. Only on some French
trips consisting of a TGV and a TER two products need to be used.
In fare mode, no product exists as first needs to created from the different fares.

distributorBookingRef.description: reference to the booking in the downstream distributor system

afterSaleConditions.description: Fine grained specification of the after sale condition of the booking.

ExchangeableType.description:
If set to YES the offerpart is exchangeable without a fee before the day of departure. 
NO when not exchangeable or exchangeable with 100% fee, WITH_CONDITIONS in all other cases.

ProductLegAssociation.description:
In offer mode, in almost all cases exactly one product is referenced. Only on some French
trips consisting of a TGV and a TER two products need to be used.
In fare mode, no product exists as first needs to created from the different fares.

legIds.description: indices of the legs in the trip given by the provider of the offer

AfterSaleCondition.description: After sale amounts for a given offer.

products.description: The list of all products available to the caller.

Product.description: Structured description of the product, its name, comfort and sales / after-sales conditions

summary.description: A human-readable description of the product.

code.description:
The product code expressed in the provider system (could be a
mapping from an even lower-level provider).

conditions.description: Structured description of the sales or after-sales conditions.

tariff.description:
Mapping to Tariff 42 of IRS-90918-3 (Hermes/Hosa). Helps the H2O converter in mapping
offers to a requested tariff. See legacyReservationParameter.tariff in OSDM offline.

CombinationTag.description:
Tag to indicate that some products from a provider can be sold only when in conjunction
with product(s) from another provider using the same tag. At least one, not all,
combinationTags must be in common to allow combination. No combinationTags indicate
that there are no combination constraints on the product.

needsToBeCombined.description:
If false it means that this product can be sold also when not in conjunction with
a product with the same tag. This is needed to propose specific products from one
provider that depend on public ones of another.

FulfillmentMediaType.description: Fulfillment types. RCT2, RCCST and UIC_PDF are official UIC standards.

Admission.description:
An admission represents a travel right, or the entitlement to travel onboard a train between
the given origin and destination, following the given route. It does not include a seat reservation.

AdmissionOfferPart.description:
An admission represents a travel right, or the entitlement to travel onboard a train between
the given origin and destination, following the given route. It does not include a seat reservation.

Reservation.description:
Reservation includes the reference to the in the initial offer.
The offer needs to be updated with the selected places before the confirmation
which creates the reservation details including the reserved places.

ReservationOfferPart.description:
Reservation includes the reference to the in the initial offer.
The offer needs to be updated with the selected places before the confirmation
which creates the reservation details including the reserved places.

category.description: Categorization of the ancillary such as "Meal" or "Gift".

Fee.description: Fees are used to represent additional costs for services or products.  In contrast to other offer parts in OSDM, the customer is not free whether to choose a fee or not: fees are generated and applied to other services or products by the provider system.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the fee.

distributorBookingRef.description: reference to the booking in the downstream distributor system

conditions.description: Structured description of the sales or after-sales conditions.

productCode.description:
The product code expressed in the provider system (could be a
mapping from an even lower-level provider).

PromotionCode.description:
The promotion code is a token that reduces the price at POST booking time OR
Token that reduces the price at POST trip-offer-collection time OR
Token to receive offers that are not available without it.

code.description: The code issued by the issuer

issuer.description: The party that issues the promotion code, in case of a railway it's its RICS code

BookingPartReference.description:
References all the offer part elements in an uniform format.
In its part, an OfferPartReference can refer to reservation, admission, ancillary or fee.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the offer part reference.

CorporateCode.description: The corporate code is a token that reduces the price of an offer or enables  offers that are not available without it. Needs with a commercial agreement between parties.

code.description: The corporate code issued by the referenced company.

beneficiary.description: The name of the party that benefits from the corporate code, intended to be presented to the end user.

OfferPartReference.description:
References all the offer part elements in an uniform format.
In its part, an OfferPartReference can refer to reservation, admission, ancillary or fee.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the offer part reference.

offers.description: The list of offers that need to be provisionally booked, with possibly the reservations and ancillaries associated that should be booked as well.

passengerSpecifications.description: If needed (cf requiredInformation) or desired, this array allows providing the required details on some or all passengers

embed.description: Influences whether referenced resources are returned in full or as references only.

OfferSelection.description: The Ids of the offers to be booked need to be passed in.

offerId.description: id of the selected offer or exchangeOffer

optionalReservationSelections.description: Mandatory reservations are booked when the booking is being booked.

afterSaleByDistributorOnly.description:
in case the distributor has proposed this offer in conjunction with an offer of another provider constrained
by a combinationTag, this flag must be set to true to indicate to the provider that after-sale must be done
on the totality of the distributor's booking. Only after-sale requests triggered by the distributor can be
safely processed on this offer. When the flag is not set, standard provider logic applies.

AncillarySelection.description: Is some cases one out of a set of ancillary offerparts must be booked.

externalRef.description: The unique booking reference in the provider system. Usually refers to an order number or PNR.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the booking.

trips.description: This trip will be included in the offer if the offer is part of the booking.

refundOffers.description:
Refund offers are created with the details of the to-be-confirmed refund operation.
One refund offer can then be confirmed, which turns it into a refund.

BookingPatchRequest.description:
Allows setting the required fulfillment type, e.g. value paper
or e-ticket and preferred fulfillment media.
The latter is optional and relevant in some cases only.

FulfillmentOption.description: CIT paper implies printing on value paper which is stock controlled.

FulfillmentPatchRequest.description: Changes the fulfillment to status FULFILLED.

Fulfillment.description:
A fulfillment is a document (or part of a document in distributor mode) that
- allows the passenger to prove its travel right
- provides easier access to trains and stations
- allows an exchange for other services (voucher)
A fulfillment refers to services of one or multiple offer parts or a fare (distributor mode).

bookingRef.description: the id of the booking the fulfillment is part of

summary.description: A human-readable description of the fulfillment.

fulfillmentParts.description: Fulfillment items to be integrated into tickets (distributor mode).

FulfillmentPartStatus.description: Individual fulfillments of a multi journey booking need an separate patch to create the usable fulfillment in status FULFILLED before they are in an intermediate state AVAILABLE where they don't provide a document for travel. Fulfillments can be ON_HOLD in case they are booked but not yet available (e.g. a booking providing two journeys per week) or passed in case the fulfillment was not patched for usage within the required time.

FulfillmentStatus.description: Individual fulfillments of a multi journey booking need an separate patch to create the usable fulfillment in status FULFILLED before they are in an intermediate state AVAILABLE where they don't provide a document for travel. Fulfillments can be ON_HOLD in case they are booked but not yet available (e.g. a booking providing two journeys per week) or passed in case the fulfillment was not patched for usage within the required time.

FulfillmentDocument.description:
Document created for fulfillment. Either downloadLink + downloadExpiry or content + format must
be provided.

downloadExpiry.description:
Expiration time of the download link, the document will not be available at the given URI
after this time.

content.description: base64 encoded binary of the actual fulfillment document

format.description:
Physical format of the document provided in the content field in Mime-Type format, e.g.
application/pdf, image/jpeg, etc. Must be filled if the 'content' field is present.

FulfillmentPart.description:
Fulfillment items to be integrated in to tickets,
e.g. visual security elements, additional bar codes, control keys.

fulfillmentMedia.description: list of fulfillment media where this item applies

isMandatory.description: The use of the provided features is mandatory.

securePaperOnly.description: The security feature must be used on secure paper.

uri.description: link to download the security feature

FulfillmentUsage.description: In case of multi-journey products describe parameters to be used to change the a fulfillment in status AVAILABLE to FULFILLED so it can be used by the passenger.

travelDates.description:
Travel dates that can be selected. Note: date only is used to cover properly the case of passes including
multiple time zones.

maxAvailableZones.description: upper limit to the number of selected zones

SecurityFeatureType.description: Defines type and format of the security feature.

TravelValidityRange.description:
Range for the start of validity to be used in a patch for available fulfillments (e.g. a 1 hour ticket not
available during  peak hours in the morning and afternoon).

summary.description: A human-readable description of the refund offer.
summary.example: Refund Offer for Paris-Barcelona Andre Dupont 2022-07-23

validUntil.description: time until the offer can be used

RefundOfferRequest.description:
Request for a refund offer.
Fulfillments can be provided in case the booking contains multiple individual fulfillments.

fulfillmentIds.description: id of the fulfillment to refund

refundDate.description:
Indicates for passes the date taken as reference to compute possible partial refund. It is also the date taken
as reference to invalidate the pass partially refunded.

RefundOfferPatchRequest.description: Changes the refund offer to status CONFIRMED. De-confirmation by setting PROPOSED status is not supported by API.

OverruleCode.description:
Reason for and type of an after sale, code list in IRS 90918-10.
The PRM_SUPPORT_UNAVAILABLE overrule code shall only be used by the UIC PRM ABT tool.
Known Values:
- CONNECTION_BROKEN
- DEATH
- EQUIPMENT_FAILURE
- PAYMENT_FAILURE
- PRM_SUPPORT_UNAVAILABLE
- SALES_STAFF_ERROR
- STOP_NOT_SERVED
- STRIKE
- TECHNICAL_FAILURE
- TICKET_NOT_USED
- INABILITY_TO_TRAVEL: Inability to travel due to accident or sickness.

ExchangeOfferCollectionRequest.description:
Defines the parameters needed to request an exchange offer, either based on either an
existing trip (that is then passed in) plus a set of offer search
criteria, or based on trip-search and offer search criteria. At least one
of the trip or tripSearchCriteria must be set.

trips.description: Two trips are returned if  round trips are exchanged.

ExchangeOperationPatchRequest.description:
Allows modifying a general setting for the booking:
 * setting the required fulfillment type, e.g. value paper
   or e-ticket and preferred fulfillment media.
   The latter is optional and relevant in some cases only.
 * Provisionally exchanging some of the fulfillments in the booking

embed.description: Influences whether referenced resources are returned in full or as references only.

CoachLayout.description:
coach layout providing data to draw a coach layout. The items of a coach
are located via coordinates with (0,0) in the upper left corner. All
coordinates are given without sign.

id.description: id of this coachLayout on this server

summary.description: A human-readable description of the coach layout.

places.description: list of places included in the layout

number.description: place number as displayed physically on the place

icon.description:
Icon type of the graphical item type. Code list according to UIC90918-1
graphical item type e.g. silence area sign = 116

DirectionType.description:
Direction of a place, defined optional as it might be omitted in
case of berths in future. 
Code list according to UIC90918-1
Valid Values:
- RIGHT: to right
- LEFT: to left
- UP: up (from right side of a coach pointing to the middle of the aisle)
- DOWN: down (from right side of the coach pointing to the middle of the aisle)

RemarkType.description:
Remark concerning the place (e.g. to be used in a tool tip).
Code list according to UIC90918-1
Known Values:
- MIGHT_HAVE_TABLE: place might have a table
- MIGHT_NOT_HAVE_TABLE: table at the place might be missing
- MIGHT_HAVE_DIFFERENT_DIRECTION: place might have a different direction
- MIGHT_HAVE_TABLE_AND_DIFFERENT_DIRECTION: place might have a table and a different direction
- MIGHT_NOT_HAVE_TABLE_AND_MIGHT_HAVE_DIFFERENT_DIRECTION: table at the place might be missing and place might have a different direction
- MIGHT_BE_IN_COMPARTMENT: place might be in compartment
- MIGHT_BE_IN_OPEN_SPACE: place might be in open space

x.description: horizontal coordinate of the center of the place

y.description: vertical coordinate of the center of the place

zOrder.description:
Graphical layer where this item has to be placed.
Code list according to UIC90918-1
  - value 0: lowest layer usually used for walls
  - value 1: middle layer usually used by places
  - value 2: top layer usually used by icons

Problem.description:
Problem Details for HTTP APIs (RFC 7807) defines a 'problem detail' as a way
to carry machine-readable details of errors in a HTTP response to avoid
the need to define new error response formats for HTTP APIs.
See: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807

type.description:
An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced,
it SHOULD provide human-readable documentation for the problem type
(e.g., using HTML).

status.description:
The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence
of the problem.

detail.description:
A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence
of the problem.

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

CustomerComplaint.description: complaint details provided by the passengers

applicationTime.description: date and time when the claim was made. This starts the legal time line to process the claim

ticketControlNumber.description: list of ticket control number (visible ticket identification for the customer)

iban.description: IBAN to be used in Europe

accountId.description: bank account id to be used outside of EU

SupportingDocument.description: The supporting document helps to supporting the claim.  Either downloadLink + downloadExpiry or content + format must be provided.

title.example: delay confirmation written by staff on board

content.description: base64 encoded binary of the actual document

format.description:
Physical format of the document provided in the content field in Mime-Type format, e.g. 
application/pdf, image/jpeg, etc. Must be filled if the 'content' field is present.

ImpactType.description:
Known Values:
- DELAY: delayed arrival
- JOURNEY_ABANDONED: trip way abandoned during the travel
- JOURNEY_NOT_STARTED: trip was not started due to the delay
- SERVICE_DEGRADED: e.g. service class not provided

connectionMissed.description: connection missed due to a delay on the previous leg

ComplaintPatchRequest.description:
Changes to a claim already made.
This covers upload of additional supporting documents, changes to  the passenger and claim manager data.
The patch of the compensation amount requires an agreement between the involved parties and is used in
case the legal time line for deciding the claim is passed.

ComplaintChangeReason.description:
Known Values:
- BANK_ACCOUNT
- SETTLED_TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: A distributor settled the claim as the fare provided did not reply in due time. The compensation amount debited is provided.
- PASSENGER_CHANGE

BackOfficeStatus.description:
Status of the request sent to the back office.
Valid Values:
- INITIATED
- EVALUATING
- DECIDED
- SETTLED
- INFORMATION_MISSING
- REQUEST_UPDATED: Additional information, i.e. documents have been provided which should trigger reevaluation.

delayedJourney.description: Allocator or fare provider view on the delays. This might differ from the customer view.

cardIdRequired.description: the card id must be delivered in online sales

includedCardTypes.description: This card includes the listed cards

serviceClassTypes.description: list of service classes where this card applies

ZoneDefinition.description:
Definition of a zone used to define regional validity. The area of the zone can be defined via a
geo-polygon, a complete list of all contained stations or area codes from the NUTS code list.
The carrier is either the carrier or transport authority responsible for the definition.

Fare.description: The online representation of a fare.

id.description: id of the fare item to be included in accounting

prices.description: allows specifying a price in multiple currencies

passengerConstraints.description: passenger constraint to be included in bar codes

requiredCards.description: One of the listed cards is required to be valid at the time of travel.

RegionalConstraint.description: Regional constraint of the fare- offline bulk data use the id of connection points whereas  in an online environment the connection point is included

conditions.description: Structured description of the after-sales conditions.

isSupportingIndividualContracts.description: Indicates that the after sales of this fare can be treated independently per person.

acceptedBarCodes.description: for SiD fulfillment one of the listed bar codes is required

requiredBarCodes.description: One of the listed bar codes must be provided.

isIndividualTicketingForbidden.description: a separate fulfillment per passenger is forbidden

TravelValidity.description: In distributor mode, travel validity data is needed to create barcode and control data (IRS 90918-4) even in case they have been checked during the on-line sale.

excludedTimeRanges.description: time ranges excluded from the validity (e.g. off peak fulfillments)

numberOfTravelDays.description: number of allowed travel days (e.g. 3 travel days within 2 weeks)

number.description: number of passengers with this constraint

LegacyAccountingIdentifier.description: identifier of the fare in the current 301 accounting file

addId.description:
Sequential number of regional validities (leading positions in case the series
is too short).

tariffId.description: Tariff id for the old series format.

LegacyReservationParameter.description: reservation parameter to support the UIC 90918-1 interface for booking

serviceLevelCode.description: service level code defined in UIC 90918-1

serviceCode.description: service code to be used in reservation

berthType.description: berth type code in UIC 90918-1 to be used in reservation

coachTypeCode.description: coach type code in UIC 90918-1 to be used in reservation

compartmentTypeCode.description: compartment type code in UIC 90918-1 to be used in reservation

tariffs.description: tariff according to UIC 90918-1 to be used for booking

BarCodeType.description: Item according to IRS 90918-9: FCB, TLB, SSB

TripInterruptionProcess.description:
Known Values:
- NONE
- MANUAL: passenger needs manual confirmation of train or station staff to interrupt the trip.
- ACTIVATION: Passenger needs to deactivate the ticket during the interruption (via an app).

TripAllocationProcess.description:
Known Values:
- NONE: Individual trips don't need to be allocated.
- MANUAL: The passenger has to allocate a trip manually (This should not be used as it is by design non-interoperable).
- ACTIVATION: Individual trips can be allocated by activation of the ticket.
- FULFILLMENT: A new fulfillment needs to be created to allocate a trip.

TripAllocationUnit.description:
Unit to allocate trips in a multi-trip fare. Trips can be allocated per day (e.g. Eurail) or per
duration (e.g. multiples of a duration unit to cover the trip) or as single trips (e.g. carnet))
Known Values:
- NONE: Individual trips don't need to be allocated. 
- TRIP: allocation per individual trip.
- DAY: The allocation is per travel day.
- DURATION: the allocation is per duration.

TripAllocationConstraint.description: constraint on the use of a multiple trip ticket

maxUnits.description: maximum number of allowed units to be allocated

durationUnit.description: multiples of this duration can be allocated

requiredProcesses.description: one of the listed processes is required for the allocation of a single trip

TripInterruptionConstraint.description:
rules on allowed trip interruptions. Interruptions due to a train change
indicated by a trip search must not be included here.

totalMaxDuration.description: maximum duration of all interruptions on the route

requiredProcesses.description: one of the listed processes is required for the interruption of the trip

RegulatoryCondition.description:
General conditions applied to cover legal regulations within the area of validity. Allocators must
reflect these terms and conditions in the conditions of combined offers and indicate them to the customer
where required. Which indications are mandatory to be shown to the customer is defined in the SCICs.

Valid Values:
- CIV: terms and conditions according to COTIV regulation
- MD: terms and conditions according to SMPS regulation
- EU_PRR: terms and conditions according to EU-PRR regulation

dates.description: dates included in the calendar. In case no dates are provided the range is assumed to be valid

utcOffset.description: offset to UTC in minutes (number of minutes to be added to get UTC dates)

FareCombinationModel.description: Defines the model according to which the fares can be combined.

model.description: A distributor needs to support the following models:  SEPARATE_TICKET, SEPARATE_CONTRACT, CLUSTERING, COMBINING.

combinableCarriers.description:
List of all carriers where the model can be applied, in case the list is empty
all combinations are allowed.

isValidOnlyWhenCombined.description: This combination model applies only in case the fare is combined with another carrier

referenceCluster.description: In case of CLUSTERING model: the cluster to which the fare belongs

allowedClusters.description: In case of CLUSTERING model: the other clusters that allow a combination

allowedCommonContracts.description: List of carriers where a common contract with separate fulfillments are allowed.

ServiceConstraint.description: Either excluded or included service brands can be set.

RegionalValidity.description: One of the elements Zone, ViaStation, TrainLink, Line, or Polygon defining the regional validity

seqNb.description: order number of the list item

Line.description:
terminalStation - in case the product requires a destination within the zone (e.g. local ticket
to go to the main rail station).
entryStation - Station to enter the zone in case the product requires to enter the zone via a
specific station (e.g. local zone ticket to start from the main rail station).

binaryLineId.description: Id to support local traffic standards (e.g. VDV,...).

nutsCode.description:
Nomenclature des units territoriales statistiques
 COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 31/2011

travelDate.description: date and time of the departure where the train link starts

serviceBrandAbbreviation.description: Abbreviation of the service brand, e.g. "IC", "TGV". See the OSDM code list. Needs to match the service brand code.

Route.description: Route description including the first and last real stopPoint

routeItemList.description: list of route items referenced within the list

RouteItem.description: Items to compose routes (Note - replaced viaStation, content compliant with viaStation in IRS 90918-4 and 90918-9)

alternativeRouteItemIndices.description: list of alternative route parts to be used on this travel path referenced by the index in the provided list of route items

routeItemIndices.description: sequence of route items along the travel path referenced by the index in the provided list of route items

FareReferenceStation.description:
Reference to a list of stations jointly valid in a fare. The fare
reference station defines a set of station that are equivalent from
a tariff point of view. The code is issued by the carrier. Needed to
generate bar codes as well as fulfillments.

CarrierConstraint.description: Either excluded or included carriers can be set.

Zone.description:
carrier - carrier responsible for the transport.
entryStation - Station to enter the zone in case the product requires to enter the zone via a specific station
(e.g. local zone ticket to start from the main rail station).
terminalStation - Terminal station in case the product requires a destination within the zone (e.g. local ticket
to go to the main rail station).

binaryZoneId.description: Id to support local traffic standards (e.g. VDV,...)

zoneIds.description: to be used in bar codes

nutsCode.description: Nomenclature des units territoriales statistiques COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 31/2011

ControlSecurityType.description:
Known Values:
- SiP: secure paper tickets
- SiD: security in data (signed bar code)
- SiS: security in system

LegacyReservationTariff.description: Legacy tariff code and number of items or persons in case UIC 90918-1 is used for booking.

number.description: number of items with this tariff code

FareType.description: Basic UIC fare types used in 90918-10, 90918-4, and 90918-9.

FareConnectionPoint.description:
Connection point connecting two fare regimes. The connection is possible between stations of the two provided station sets.
A legacy border point code (id) might be provided as an additional code within the stations (code list BORDER_POINT provided in URN).
In case the connection point is a real station this station is indicated.
In case the connection point is between stations for each side of the border real stations must be provided.
Multiple sets of station can be provided in the rare case that the connection point connects more than two station (A-B and A-C).
Multiple stations within a set at one side of the border might be provided in case of changes (new stations build near the border).

Providing the UIC code for the station is mandatory.

TrainValidity.description:
Validity depending on boarding / leaving of a train. The ticket is valid
from departure until the destination station in the train if departure or destination is within the from - until range.
The validation can reference the departure or the destination time to decide the validity (e.g. Eurail/Interrail passes
currently use the departure for the validity on night trains).

GeoPosition.description: WGS84 coordinates position. Provided by OJP.

Longitude.description: Longitude from Greenwich Meridian. -180 (West) to +180 (East). Decimal degrees. eg 2.356.

Latitude.description: Latitude from equator. -90 (South) to +90 (North). Decimal degrees. e.g. 56.356.

Section.description:
Allows to indicate the sub-part of the trip. LegIds are only relevant if
a trip can be referenced. When absent, the totality of the trip is priced.

Link.description:
The underlying system may provide links for pagination of links pointing on
further information (such as HTML download links, web sites or extended APIs).
Mechanism to add flexible extensions specific to an underlying system. Implemented
the JSON-HAL specification.

href.description: Allows to provide a value to the link, for example id of the targeted resource or displayable representation for the link.

type.description: Hint to indicate the media type expected when dereferencing the target resource.

value.description: Allows to provide a value to the link, for example id of the targeted resource or displayable representation for the link.

Text.description: Directly included text in case of online services. Text must be encoded in UTF-8 format.

scale.description: scale of the amount - the number of positions after the comma
scale of the amount - the number of positions after the comma

CompanyRef.description:
Identifies a company. For rail, a RICS company code or compatible ERA company code are used. 

E.g.: "urn:uic:rics:1185:000011"

ServiceBrandCode.description: Service brand codes. For public transport, a code list can be found in OSDM's code list. E.g., '163' denotes TGV Lyria and '175' denotes Glacier Express.

name.description: The name the carrier itself uses to designate this specific service class.

ServiceClassType.description: Type of quality level, finer grained than the comfort class.

Condition.description: Describes sales, usage and after sales conditions applicable to the product.  See after sales conditions for individual after sales amounts. The language of the text is controlled by the accept-language header, i.e. supporting English is a must.

description.description: human readable documentation of the text.

shortDescription.description: short description of the condition no longer than 64 characters

AvailablePlace.description: Describes the details of the available places.

placeProperties.description: Selectable place properties for the offer. For AccommodationSubType=ANY_SEAT all available and bookable properties need to be returned to give a sales tool a list of possible selections.

numericAvailability.description: For the AccommodationSubType=ANY_SEAT the total amount of places for the combination of AccommodationType and AccommodationSubType needs to returned.

PlaceAllocation.description: Describes the details of the reserved place(s).

reservedPlaces.description:
Reserved places in a confirmed reservation.
Multiple place packs are needed to combined person and bicycle reservations

ReservedPlace.description: In distributor mode placeProperties are mandatory to be returned.

placeProperties.description: place properties to be indicated to the customer

AccommodationType.description: Accommodation type definition out of the Accommodation Type Code List

AccommodationSubType.description: Accommodation sub type definition out of the Accommodation Sub Type Code List

PlaceSelection.description:
Place selection options and selected options in an offer
- reference place for adjacent reservation
- selected optional place properties
- selected places from a graphical place selection

preferenceGroups.description: possible preferences to be requested in reservation without changing the fare

graphicalReservation.description: graphical reservation is supported, interface type 'NO','UIC_918',..

SelectedReferencePlace.description: reference place for an adjacent reservation

SelectedAccommodation.description: Place selection of places for reservation linked to passengers.

placeProperties.description:
Properties of places as defined in 90810-10.
selection from the optional place properties provided in the offer

Vehicle.description:
List of the coaches in a vehicle run ordered according to the physical
ordering of the vehicle.

layoutId.description: id to identify the coach layout

layoutIdUpperDeck.description: id to identify a layout for the upper deck in a double deck coach

layoutIdLowerDeck.description: id to identify a layout for the lower deck in a double deck coach

TravelDirectionType.description:
indication of the direction of travel standard direction is left
to right with ascending coordinates in the layout values.

Compartment.description:
Areas within a coach that holds places. Areas might be selectable
as a whole. Usual areas would be classic compartments.

isSelectable.description: Indicates whether compartments are selectable as a whole only

number.description: place number as indicated at the place in the coach

isSelectable.description:
Flag to indicate individual places as non-selectable in
case complete compartments must be selected.

AvailabilityStatus.description: status of the place or coach

SelectedPlace.description: selected place in case of graphical booking

externalRef.description: A stable reference to a purchaser from other elements, or from caller system. When received in input of a request, it must be echoed back in the response.

PurchaserSpecification.description: Minimal specification of a purchaser to request booking of an offer.

externalRef.description: A stable reference to a purchaser from other elements, or from caller system. When received in input of a request, it must be echoed back in the response.

Passenger.description:
Information about a passenger.

Either the date of birth or the age at the time of travel needs to be set. We recommend to use date of birth as it is more stable than age.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the passenger.

externalRef.description:
A stable reference to a passenger from other elements, or from caller system.
When passed in passenger specification in an offer request, it must be echoed back in the
response.

dateOfBirth.description: date of birth of the passenger

cards.description: reduction or loyalty cards owned by the passenger

prmNeeds.description: For the persons with reduced mobility (PRMs) its specific needs for support are expressed.

AnonymousPassengerSpecification.description:
Minimal specification of a passenger to request offers without any GDPR relevant attributes such as name or address.

Either the date of birth or the age at the time of travel needs to be set. We recommend to use date of birth as it is more stable than age.

externalRef.description: A stable reference to a passenger from other elements, or from caller system. When received in input of a request, it must be echoed back in the response.

dateOfBirth.description:
Date of birth of the passenger. Only needed for passengers of type persons, family child, PRM
and wheelchair.

age.description: Age of the passenger  at the date of travel. Less stable than the state of birth.

PassengerSpecification.description:
Minimal specification of a passenger to request offers.

Either the date of birth or the age at the time of travel needs to be set. We recommend to use date of birth as it is more stable than age.

externalRef.description: A stable reference to a passenger from other elements, or from caller system. When received in input of a request, it must be echoed back in the response.

dateOfBirth.description:
Date of birth of the passenger. Only needed for passengers of type persons, family child, PRM
and wheelchair.

age.description: Age of the passenger  at the date of travel. Less stable than the state of birth.

cards.description: reduction or loyalty cards owned by the passenger

prmNeeds.description: For the persons with reduced mobility (PRMs) its specific needs for support are expressed.

PassengerType.description:
Passenger type according to UIC passenger, i.e. passenger type list.
See https://unioninternationalcheminsdefer.github.io/OSDM/spec/catalog-of-code-lists/
Proposed default PERSON

PersonDetail.description:
Personal information potentially needed at booking step. To support privacy by design,
it is not permitted to send personal information not required to create a valid booking.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the person.

phoneNumber.description:
Preferably a mobile phone number, to be contacted in case changes to the booking occur, e.g.,
in case of interruptions.

Gender.description: The gender of the passenger, which is important in the case of night trains.

Transportable.description:
Transportables which are handled similar to passengers like dogs, bicycles, car transport.
These transportables might need a ticket or reservation.

TransportableType.description: Subset of the values from the passenger type code list IRS 90918-10

model.description: Free text description of the model (e.g. BMW X5)

attachedItems.description: Indication of items attached to the car

licensePlate.description:
The license plate is a personal data item and must not be provided in an offer request.
It must be patched into the offer after the customer accepted the offer for booking.

AttachableItemType.description: Indication of items attached to the car

licensePlate.description:
The license plate is a personal data item and must not be provided in an offer request.
It must be patched into the offer after the customer accepted the offer for booking

The license plate is a personal data item and must not be provided in an offer request.
It must be patched into the offer after the customer accepted the offer for booking

IdentificationCard.description:
Person identification information  to be exchanged for border control if legally required.

It is not allowed to send personal information not required in the offer reply.
It is legally not allowed to send these personal data already in the offer request.

type.description: Refer to code list for values

name.description: ICAO transliteration identical as written in the document

issuingCity.description: place where the document is issued

objectType.description: Attribute is used as discriminator for inheritance between data types.
Attribute is used as discriminator for inheritance between data types.

offerId.description: The offerId of the offer containing the offerparts to be added.
The offerId of the offer containing the offerparts to be added.

BookingResponseContent.description: Influences whether referenced resources are returned in full or as references only.

distributorBookingRef.description: reference to the booking in the downstream distributor system

BookingSearchResult.description: Summary of the booking found by the booking search. For more information, get the booking.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the refund offer.

validUntil.description: time until the offer can be used

CardReference.description: Number and issuer are needed to identify a travel account, the code identifies a reduction card.

code.description: Code of the card type according to issuer. E.g. BahnCard50.

number.description: Number identifying the travel account, need issuer to be unique.

Document.description: Non travel document created. Either downloadLink + downloadExpiry or content + format must be provided.

passengerRef.description: Reference to a passenger, to be specified when the document related to an individual passenger.

downloadExpiry.description: Expiration time of the download link, the document will not be available at the given URI  after this time.

content.description: base64 encoded binary of the actual fulfillment document

format.description: Physical format of the document provided in the content field in Mime-Type format, e.g. application/pdf, image/jpeg, etc. Must be filled if the "content" field is present.

DocumentSpecification.description: Non travel document created. Either downloadLink + downloadExpiry or content + format must be provided.

passengerRef.description: Reference to a passenger, to be specified when the document related to an individual passenger.

content.description: base64 encoded binary of the actual fulfillment document

format.description: Physical format of the document provided in the content field in Mime-Type format, e.g. application/pdf, image/jpeg, etc. Must be filled if the "content" field is present.

Event.description: Record of an action that occurred in the life cycle of the booking.

summary.description: human readable description of the event

requestor.description: Contains detailed information about who is calling the API. It can include information such as channel, organization, sales unit or workstation id and be used to configure e.g. the fare range provided to the caller. The content of the string is part of a bilateral contract by the two parties and not standardized by OSDM. It is recommend to encrypt the information transferred.

ExchangeOperationResponseContent.description: Influences whether referenced resources are returned in full or as references only.

ExcludedTimeRange.description: time ranges excluded from the validity (e.g. off peak fulfillments)

from.description: minutes of the day in the time zone of travel

until.description: minutes of the day in the time zone of travel

FulfillmentActivationPatchRequest.description:
Changes the fulfillment to status AVAILABLE. In the case of multi-journey  product, one of the fulfillment is
now "activated" and can be used to travel.

stockControlNumbers.description:
The ids of the secure paper stock that identifies the blank secure paper stock used for printing.

The stock control number is only used for secure paper stock and triggers a printing of the stock control number in the ticket layout. This establishes a link between paper stock and ticket that is used to control the usage of blank secure paper stock at offices as secure paper has otherwise no intrinsic protection against internal fraud.

LegAttribute.description: Attributes that are not valid on the whole service, but only on section of a trip made on a single mode without interchange between boarding and alighting.

text.description: Text of the attribute to be shown to the user.

code.description: Internal code of the attribute. Can be used for detection of double occurrences.

fromStopSeqNumber.description: The attribute is valid from the stop point with this sequence number within the leg. If missing it is valid from the beginning of the leg.

toStopSeqNumber.description: The attribute is valid to the stop point (inclusively) with this sequence number within the leg. If missing it is valid to the end of the leg.

LuggageConstraint.description: Constraint on the luggage allowed by a passenger to on board.

value.description: Value of the dimension: weight in kg, length in cm, volume in liter.

LuggageDimensionEnum.description:
Type of the dimension. Combined sizes are the sum of the sizes.

Explanation:  WIDTH_HEIGHT_LENGTH = sum of width, hight and length in cm (= linear equivalent).

dimensionRestrictions.description: The dimension apply to the luggage items as upper limits.

numberOfItems.description: Number of luggage items allowed with this restriction.

registrationIds.description: The registrationIds to be included in a bar code on the fulfillment (UIC IRS 90918-4) (e.g. on a luggage tag).

LuggageRestrictionRuleEnum.description:
Named luggage restriction rule.

Valid Values:
- CAN_CARRY: Weight is ok if you can carry it yourself.

MultiRideBalance.description: The balance of the travel account.

NamedCompany.description: Provides the reference and name of a company.

name.description: Textual representation of the carrier to be displayed unless the application is able to indicate the name by the carrier references.

NonTripSearchCriteria.description:
Defines the requested validity when searching specifically for a non-trip Offer. 

The geographical validity can either be specified by a list of nutsCodes, by a list of places (e.g. stations) with the semantics that trips between either of any of the listed stations are covered (e.g. Frankfurt (Main) Hbf, Friedberg(Hess) and Hanau Hbf, which would imply that any travel between these stations is to be covered), or a list of zones (e.g. with carrier urn:vdv:rmv, the zones with the ids 50, 2501 and 3001 would cover the same area as the list of stations above).

nutsCodes.description: Nomenclature des units territoriales statistiques COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 31/2011

NotVia.description: Not-via restrictions for a trip, i.e. scheduled stop points or stop places that the trip is not allowed to pass through.  Provided by OJP.

OfferMode.description:
Offer mode applied to provide offers for given criteria. 

Individual offer mode means that each passenger is given individual admissions and reservations  to allow to refund individual passengers booked in a single booking.

If collective mode is not supported,  reverts back to the other mode and provides warning instead.

OnHoldOfferRequest.description: Confirming the offer puts into the "On-hold" state.

increaseTTL.description: increase of time to live (in minutes)

PaymentMethod.description: Method of payment used by the customer to the distributor. On input of voucher the remaining sum attribute is not present.

ProductSummary.description: Summary of the booking's underlining products.

Quantity.description: Generic entity to model a quantity.

Reimbursement.description: Customers who have bought a ticket which allows reimbursement and which have not traveled or traveled partially only can claim to be reimbursed. The customer must prove that he has not or only partially used the ticket. A partial use might be a only a part of the trip was traveled or only some of the travelers were traveling or a combination of both.

ReimbursementDecision.description: Decision whether or not the reimbursement is granted. Contains information on the amount reimbursed.

ReimbursementReason.description: Reason why the booking should be reimbursed.

ReimbursementRequest.description: The reimbursement process is used to support refunds which are not covered by the online refund/exchange processes, e.g.: Partial refund of a trip (Trip was Hamburg - Munich, but only Hamburg - Kassel was used), Refund outside of rules due to good will. This is a manual back office process within the provider's organization which is triggered by this request. State changes can be signaled by web hook events.

ReimbursementResponse.description: Response to a reimbursement request, containing a state and a decision.

summary.description: A human-readable description of the refund offer.

validUntil.description: time until the offer can be used

ReturnConstraint.description: a return trip with the same carrier must be sold in combination

latestReturn.description: number of days after departure or start of validity of the last return

earliestReturn.description: number of days after departure or start of validity of the earliest return

excludedWeekdays.description: weekdays (ISO day of the week, 1 = Monday) between travel and return where travel is not allowed

ThroughTicketTag.description:
Known Values:
- RESPLUS: Through ticket tag according to Swedish Regulation.

TripCoverage.description:
The trip coverage defines which part of the trip is covered by the offer or the booking respectively.

If neither leg ids nor section ids are not defined, the complete trip is covered.

coveredLegIds.description: Indicate which legs are covered by the specific offer. Not used for fares.

ValidityType.description:
Type of usage, either as single trip or multiple trips. Unrestricted fares might be combined 
into single trips if appropriate.

code.description: voucher code provided by the issuer
